instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1398 MacBook Pro 820-00163 in boot loop
threads.message:
I have a 820-00163 that chimes and starts up half-way, then kernel panics and restarts. Same for external and internal drives. Passes the Apple Hardware Test. I replaced the EFI chip (U6100) with no change.

I'm not the first work on this board; looks like the area near the SMC has had work done. Could this be an SMC issue?

threads.title: A1398 MacBook Pro 820-00163 in boot loop
threads.message:
Could be Discrete GPU problem.
Try starting in safe mode.

threads.title: A1398 MacBook Pro 820-00163 in boot loop
threads.message: Both Safe Mode and Recovery stall near the end of the startup process.

threads.title: A1398 MacBook Pro 820-00163 in boot loop
threads.message: ME region cleaned properly when swapping SPI ROM?

threads.title: A1398 MacBook Pro 820-00163 in boot loop
threads.message: I transplanted (soldered) the EFI chip from a working identical model, no programming done. This has usually worked in the past, but did not improve anything on this board.

threads.title: A1398 MacBook Pro 820-00163 in boot loop
threads.message: This cannot work on anything starting from 1st gen Core i, you need to clean ME region when transferring from another board.

threads.title: A1398 MacBook Pro 820-00163 in boot loop
threads.message:
You have 4 months on the forum.
Didn't read any post about ME region yet???

threads.title: A1398 MacBook Pro 820-00163 in boot loop
threads.message: I'm relatively new and not set up for any kind of reprogramming. My approach to getting rid of the occasional EFI lock has been to swap EFI chips (new or transplanted). Will certainly read up on the details of the SPI ROM, thank you.

threads.title: A1398 MacBook Pro 820-00163 in boot loop
threads.message: I suppose you don't have Medusa programmer, so upload somewhere original file.

threads.title: A1398 MacBook Pro 820-00163 in boot loop
threads.message: I installed a brand-new SPI ROM with guaranteed clean ME region. But the same issue persists: half-way startup, then kernel panic. Verbose mode shows this screen just before restarting.

threads.title: A1398 MacBook Pro 820-00163 in boot loop
threads.message:
Where did you get that chip?
Who programmed it?

Could be RAM issue, or GPU.

threads.title: A1398 MacBook Pro 820-00163 in boot loop
threads.message:
A chip supplier off eBay (advancednetwork) I have used before. Have installed ~10 brand-new EFI chips from them in MacBook Pros with 100% success rate.

Any way to test if it's the GPU?

threads.title: A1398 MacBook Pro 820-00163 in boot loop
threads.message: Why do not you reflsh the SPI yourself with 100% clean ME???
